item.title: 全球关税缓解，欧洲股票期货大涨
item.description: 在特朗普政府对其部分最新关税措施表现出灵活性后，欧洲股票期货攀升。【原文：European stock futures climbed after the Trump administration indicated flexibility on some of its latest tariff measures.】

item.title: 软银将在马来西亚的芯片雄心中扮演重要角色
item.description: Arm Holdings Plc 已同意在未来十年内向马来西亚提供芯片设计和技术，旨在使这个东南亚国家超越芯片组装，进入更有价值的半导体生产领域。【原文：Arm Holdings Plc has agreed to provide chip designs and technology to Malaysia over the next decade, aimed at catapulting the Southeast Asian country beyond chip assembly and into more valuable semiconductor production.】

item.title: 中国计划为大型银行发行 690 亿美元特别债券
item.description: 根据中国政府的年度工作报告，中国计划发行 5000 亿元人民币（690 亿美元）的特别主权债券，以增加最大银行的资本金，支持经济复苏。【原文：China plans to issue 500 billion yuan ($69 billion) in special sovereign bonds as it seeks to boost capital at its biggest banks to support the economic recovery, according to the government’s annual work report.】

item.title: 马斯克在法庭斗争中未能阻止 OpenAI 重组计划
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）未能阻止山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）重组 OpenAI，同时他还声称这家初创公司触犯了反垄断法，这是继他以 974 亿美元收购竞争对手人工智能公司控制权的提议遭到拒绝后，世界首富遭受的又一打击。【原文：Elon Musk failed to halt Sam Altman from restructuring OpenAI while he pursues claims that the startup has run afoul of antitrust laws, another blow for the world’s richest person after his $97.4 billion offer to take control of the rival artificial intelligence company was rebuffed.】

item.title: 新西兰中央银行行长奥尔意外辞职
item.description: 新西兰储备银行行长阿德里安-奥尔（Adrian Orr）意外辞职，但未说明突然离职的原因。【原文：Reserve Bank of New Zealand Governor Adrian Orr has unexpectedly resigned without giving a reason for his sudden departure.】

item.title: 在美国寻求削减开支之际，中国加大军费开支
item.description: 中国将在 2025 年把国防开支增加约 7.2%，与去年的增幅持平，这也反映了习近平主席建立一支能够挑战美国的军队的雄心。【原文：China is set to increase its defense spending by about 7.2% in 2025, matching last year’s growth and reflecting President Xi Jinping’s ambition to build a military that can challenge the US.】

item.title: 澳大利亚经济加速，支持澳大利亚央行的鹰派立场
item.description: 澳大利亚经济在去年最后三个月加速增长，支持了储备银行即使在上月降息后仍对进一步放宽政策采取谨慎态度。【原文：Australia’s economy accelerated in the final three months of last year, supporting the Reserve Bank’s cautious approach to further policy easing even after it cut interest rates last month.】

item.title: 中国计划在 2025 年将单位 GDP 能耗降低 3
item.description: 中国计划在 2025 年将国内生产总值增长所需的能源量减少约 3%。【原文：China plans to reduce the amount of energy it uses to grow its gross domestic product by around 3% in 2025.】

item.title: 字节跳动公司将以 3120 亿美元的估值回购美国员工股票
item.description: 字节跳动有限公司（ByteDance Ltd. ）计划回购员工股票，估值约为 3120 亿美元，较此前水平大幅提高，反映出中国科技股前景一片光明。【原文：ByteDance Ltd. plans to buy back employee stock at a valuation of about $312 billion, a significant markup from previous levels that reflects a brightening outlook for Chinese tech shares.】

item.title: 贸易战支撑避险需求，黄金稳定在历史高位附近
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税大棒推动了避险需求，黄金在前两个交易日上涨超过 2% 后，持稳于纪录高点附近。【原文：Gold was steady near a record high, after rising more than 2% over the previous two sessions as President Donald Trump’s tariff barrage drove haven demand.】

item.title: 中国官方预算赤字升至 30 多年来最高水平
item.description: 中国将一般预算赤字提高到三十多年来的最高水平，因为中国政府正在增加支出，以应对美国关税上涨的影响。【原文：China raised its general budget deficit to the highest level in more than three decades, as Beijing ramps up spending to counter the effects of rising US tariffs.】

item.title: 中国决策者将年度通胀目标定为 2% 左右
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）看到的一份政府年度工作报告显示，中国二十多年来首次将年度通胀目标下调至 2% 左右，改变了长期以来 3% 的目标。【原文：China lowered its annual inflation target to around 2% for the first time in more than two decades, according to a copy of the government’s annual work report seen by Bloomberg News, shifting away from the longstanding 3% goal.】

item.title: 尽管美国加征关税，中国仍将 GDP 目标设定在 5%左右
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的一份政府年度工作报告，中国将 2025 年的经济增长目标设定为 5%左右，这提高了人们对中国官员在应对美国贸易战时释放更多刺激政策的预期。【原文：China set its economic growth goal at about 5% for 2025, according to a copy of the government’s annual work report seen by Bloomberg News, raising expectations for officials to unleash more stimulus as they grapple with a US trade war.】

item.title: 阿达尼耗资 21 亿美元新建的孟买机场吸引低成本航空公司
item.description: 纳维孟买机场是亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）为印度商业之都开发的第二个机场，目标是在 5 月投入使用，印度的低成本航空公司将率先向该机场转移。【原文：India’s low-cost carriers will lead the shift to the Navi Mumbai Airport, the highly anticipated second airport for the commercial capital developed by billionaire Gautam Adani, as it targets a May opening.】

item.title: 尽管美国加征关税，中国仍将 GDP 目标设定在 5%左右
item.description: 3月4日，中国国家主席习近平在北京人民大会堂出席中国人民政治协商会议开幕式。摄影师佩德罗-帕尔多/法新社/盖蒂图片社【原文：China's President Xi Jinping attends the opening ceremony of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on March 4. Phtoographer: Pedro Pardo/AFP/Getty Images】

item.title: 特朗普的乌克兰支点助推全球国防股100%上涨
item.description: 华盛顿已明确表示，欧洲需要自卫。对一些投资者来说，这是在为国防类股票 "充电"。【原文：Washington has made it clear that Europe needs to defend itself. For some investors, that’s a call to load up on defense stocks.】

item.title: 私人信贷寻求为沃尔格林收购案提供 45 亿美元资金
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，私人信用贷款机构正在洽谈提供约 45 亿美元的债务，为 Sycamore Partners 收购沃尔格林博姿联盟公司（Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc.【原文：Private credit lenders are in talks to provide about $4.5 billion of debt to fund Sycamore Partners’ potential buyout of Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. as part of a plan to split up the pharmacy retailer into separate businesses, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 关税减免迹象引发不确定性，石油延续跌势
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克表示，特朗普政府可能会收回对墨西哥和加拿大征收的部分关税，这给全球市场带来了更多不确定性，石油随之走低。【原文：Oil pushed lower after US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the Trump administration could walk back some tariffs on Mexico and Canada, injecting more uncertainty into global markets.】

item.title: 卡莱尔与竞争对手共同追逐印度财富资产
item.description: 凯雷投资集团公司（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：Carlyle Group Inc. is scouting for wealth assets in India that will tap into the country’s growing appetite for investing and spending, joining an increasingly competitive field.】

item.title: Oaktree 获得 Ares 和霸菱为咨询公司提供的私人贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，橡树资本管理公司（Oaktree Capital Management LP）为其最近收购的澳大利亚咨询公司 AZ Next Generation Advisory 获得了一笔 3.45 亿澳元（约合 2.14 亿美元）的私人信用贷款。【原文：Oaktree Capital Management LP has obtained an A$345 million ($214 million) private credit loan for Australian advisory firm AZ Next Generation Advisory, which it recently acquired, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 全球策略师因国防基金而大胆做多欧元
item.description: 一些全球策略师建议做多欧元兑美元，理由是共同货币和该地区在努力促进支出的过程中前景有所改善。【原文：Some global strategists are recommending going long the euro against greenback, citing an improved outlook for the common currency and the region amid efforts to boost spending.】

item.title: Forge Nano 寻求估值高达 9 亿美元的融资
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，2013 年从科罗拉多大学博尔德分校分离出来的材料科学初创公司 Forge Nano Inc.【原文：Forge Nano Inc., a materials science startup spun out of the University of Colorado Boulder in 2013, is seeking to raise new funding at a valuation of as much as $900 million, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 乐观情绪升温 中国股市或因人工智能打破人大首日跌幅
item.description: 随着中国官员齐聚一堂，举行本年度最大规模的政治集会，股票投资者乐观地认为，这一次将有所不同。【原文：As Chinese officials gather for the biggest political huddle of the year, equity investors are optimistic this time will be different.】

item.title: 关税减免的暗示令亚洲股市开盘走势不稳：市场综述
item.description: 在美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克暗示特朗普政府可能收回引发全球市场大跌的部分关税之后，亚洲股市将出现更多波动。【原文：Stocks in Asia are set for more volatility after US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick suggested the Trump administration may walk back some tariffs that sparked a global selloff in markets.】

item.title: 谷歌敦促特朗普司法部改变拆分公司的做法
item.description: 据熟悉相关讨论的人士透露，谷歌正在敦促唐纳德-特朗普总统的司法部官员以国家安全为由，放弃拆分这家搜索引擎公司。【原文：Google is urging officials at President Donald Trump’s Justice Department to back away from a push to break up the search engine company, citing national security concerns, according to people familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 日本企业加大对美出口以抢占关税先机
item.description: 日本公司正在美国囤积货物，以降低唐纳德-特朗普总统在打击中国、加拿大和墨西哥之后可能征收的任何关税的影响。【原文：Japanese companies are stockpiling goods in the US to lower the impact from any tariffs President Donald Trump might levy after hitting China, Canada and Mexico.】

item.title: 彭博投资大会首日的五大收获
item.description: 以下是周二在纽约举行的彭博投资会议第一天的五大要点。单击此处查看我们的 TOPLive 博客：【原文：Here are five key takeaways from the first day of the Bloomberg Invest conference in New York on Tuesday. Click here for our TOPLive blog:】

item.title: 铝关税问题让美国制造商陷入困境
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对加拿大和墨西哥供应的铝征收进口关税后，北美的铝行业和买家都在争相了解业务将受到怎样的影响。【原文：North America’s aluminum industry and buyers are scrambling to figure out how business will be affected after US President Donald Trump imposed import duties on Canadian and Mexican supplies.】

item.title: 卢特尼克称特朗普考虑减免部分墨西哥和加拿大关税
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周二表示，特朗普政府可能最快于明天宣布对北美自由贸易协定所涵盖的墨西哥和加拿大商品实行关税减免的途径。【原文：The Trump administration could announce a pathway for tariff relief on Mexican and Canadian goods covered by North America’s free trade agreement as soon as tomorrow, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said Tuesday.】

item.title: 加拿大主要股指受关税影响回落，抹去 2025 年涨幅
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对从加拿大进口的商品征收关税后，加拿大的主要股指失去了今年早些时候的所有涨幅，这对与美国有业务往来的公司和对经济疲软敏感的行业造成了压力。【原文：Canada’s primary stock index lost all of its gains from earlier in the year after US President Donald Trump put tariffs on imports from Canada, weighing on companies with US exposure and industries sensitive to economic weakness.】
